long_description: KModesPredict is a SQL-MR function for assigning data points to KModes clusters.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: Table containing the points on which to cluster the data.
input_tables.description: Table containing the points on which to cluster the data.

input_tables.name: model
input_tables.rDescription: The table which contains the centroids trained, from the kmeans function.
input_tables.description: The table which contains the centroids trained, from the kmeans function.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Columns from the input table to be passed through to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Columns from the input table to be passed through to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: TestModels
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies which model IDs will be used for prediction. The default behavior is to use all models.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies which model IDs will be used for prediction. The default behavior is to use all models.

argument_clauses.name: PrintDistance
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether or not the distance from each observation to its closest centroid should be printed to the output table. The default value is false.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether or not the distance from each observation to its closest centroid should be printed to the output table. The default value is false.
